summary: Every Step Forward - Chapter 1 - DreamDragon31 - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
title: Every Step Forward - Chapter 1 - DreamDragon31 - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/5
Fandom: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types, Captain America (Movies), Captain America - All Media Types, Marvel
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes & Steve Rogers, Steve Rogers & Sam Wilson, Wanda Maximoff & Steve Rogers, Steve Rogers & T'Challa, Clint Barton & Steve Rogers, Bruce Banner & Steve Rogers
Characters: Steve Rogers, James “Bucky” Barnes, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Wanda Maximoff, Clint Barton, T'Challa (Marvel), Shuri (Marvel), Thor, Bruce Banner, Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes
Additional Tags: Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Spoilers, Post-Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Canon Divergence - Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Endgame Fix-It, Fix-It, Angst, Hurt/Comfort, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Aftermath, Steve Rogers Feels, Depressed Steve Rogers, Depression, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - PTSD, Steve Rogers Has PTSD, Bucky Barnes Recovering, Protective Bucky Barnes, Bucky Barnes Has PTSD, PTSD, Sam Wilson Is a Good Bro, No Romance, Bucky Barnes Is a Good Bro, Steve Rogers Needs a Hug
Summary:

In the aftermath of Thanos’s defeat, Steve is struggling to deal with it all. The losses, the gains, the aftermath. There’s still tasks to be done, still missions to complete. But he’s tired, tired of it all. It’s time to start healing. The question is can he finally practice what he preached? Can he finally move forward?


Here it is! My first Avengers fic, a fix-it for Endgame. I’m actually very proud of how this came out and am excited for my ideas on the other chapters.

Please read it and let me know what you think!!!

summary: un comentario sobre “avengers: endgame” y las películas de marvel en general
title: un comentario sobre “avengers: endgame” y las películas de marvel en general
body:
antes de pasar a la película en sí quiero señalar lo alucinante que fue la “fiebre” por su estreno en lima, no sentía un furor colectivo así entre gente de mi edad desde que la selección jugó el mundial. por un par de semanas había gente hablando de avengers o consumiendo contenido de avengers en cada lugar al que iba. 

trataré de ir directo al grano: entiendo que la última película de avengers tiene buenos momentos pero para mí ninguna cantidad de hype -que se mete a nuestra cabeza y corrompe nuestro juicio- justifica un desarrollo narrativo y de personajes tan pobre, especialmente teniendo actores de esa talla.

scott lang (paul rudd) tiene sus momentos graciosos pero probablemente tony stark (robert downey jr) es el único personaje con un nivel de complejidad interesante (y mi favorito del MCU para siempre), las escenas con su hija y papá son bien emotivas (pepper potts bien gracias). mi sesgo personal es que no he visto sus películas standalone pero thor y capitán américa me parecieron extremadamente básicos.

es una película increíblemente larga (3 horas y 1 minuto) que no vas entender bien si es que no estás al tanto del plot de las más de 20 películas que la preceden.

me quedo con la sensación de que es un largometraje mucho más preocupado por poner check en una larga lista de deseos de los fans que de contar una buena historia, y la pena de que la gente se conforme con eso. o sea no tengo problema con que tanta gente la disfrute pero me gustaría que sean más concientes de la diferencia entre una producción como esta (fanboy-bait que pretende contar una historia de magnitudes e implicancias literalmente intergalácticas pero realmente no te hace reflexionar o cuestionar cosas o verlas desde otra perspectiva lo suficiente -que es lo que yo busco cuando consumo arte-) y una película/saga que cuenta una gran historia en múltiples dimensiones sin perder de vista el hype (harry potter me parece el ejemplo más claro de esto).

de todas formas este es el patrón de marvel hace tiempo así que no digo nada nuevo. avengers:endgame es simplemente la cereza de la torta. he visto unas 10 películas del MCU y Iron Man (2009), la primera de la saga (cuando la franquicia no tenía innumerables complicaciones infundamentadas e innecesarias), sigue pareciéndome la mejor de lejos.

summary:
"Just don't tell the others, they might get jealous, and I didn't bring enough shields for everyone."
(I know it's not exactly...
body:
“Just don’t tell the others, they might get jealous, and I didn’t bring enough shields for everyone.”

(I know it’s not exactly what Tony said, but it’s as close as I can remember)

summary: Stan Lee no alcazó a ver Avengers: Endgame, revela Kevin Feige
title: Stan Lee no alcazó a ver Avengers: Endgame, revela Kevin Feige
body:
Stan Lee no alcazó a ver Avengers: Endgame, revela Kevin Feige

Aunque Stan Lee alcanzó a grabar lo que sería su último cameo en una película, en Avengers: Endgame, el presidente de Marvel Studios, Kevin Feige, reveló que Lee no pudo ver la película, y explicó por qué.

Sucedió durante un AMA de Reddit, en el que uno de los fans preguntó qué tanto sabía Lee de Endgamey si logró visualizar la película antes de su muerte, aunque sea una versión no terminada o…

View On WordPress

blog.name: bonesingerofyme-loc

summary: dammit endgame i don’t even like them and you’re making me defend them, part 3
title: dammit endgame i don’t even like them and you’re making me defend them, part 3
body:
peter quill

look i don’t like chris pratt. i really can’t put my finger on it. it’s like andrew garfield. i’m not the kind of ngf that gives a shit about an actor’s personal life and their acting abilities are fine it’s just something about them that rubs me the wrong way.

so chris pratt. starlord. peter quill. eh. I can pass on him tbh. On all the Guardians actually, though Infinity War did make me warm to them enough that I’ll say the first Guardians movie was ok even though the second still was ass.

ANYWAY

Peter Quill. Man, they didn’t treat you well. Infinity War, ignoring the scene with Thor that went on for about thirty minutes too long, did a great job with Peter. He really had grown and changed a lot, while still retaining who he was. His scenes with Gamora were meangingful, well acted, emotional and really strengthened their relationship and bond. People were pissed at Quill for beating on Thanos, but not because it was out of character - it was because it was so relatable but at the same time an ‘aaaaugh goddamn it’ moment. 

So Quill had a pretty good arc. I don’t really give a shit about him, but I won’t deny he’s come quite a long way and Infinity War really showed some new sides to him. 

Then in Endgame his story and Gamora’s gets reduced to crude physical humor and a shitty joke.

And that’s it!

Sorry, Starlord, you deserved better.

reblog.comment:
peter quill

look i don’t like chris pratt. i really can’t put my finger on it. it’s like andrew garfield. i’m not the kind of ngf that gives a shit about an actor’s personal life and their acting abilities are fine it’s just something about them that rubs me the wrong way.

so chris pratt. starlord. peter quill. eh. I can pass on him tbh. On all the Guardians actually, though Infinity War did make me warm to them enough that I’ll say the first Guardians movie was ok even though the second still was ass.

ANYWAY

Peter Quill. Man, they didn’t treat you well. Infinity War, ignoring the scene with Thor that went on for about thirty minutes too long, did a great job with Peter. He really had grown and changed a lot, while still retaining who he was. His scenes with Gamora were meangingful, well acted, emotional and really strengthened their relationship and bond. People were pissed at Quill for beating on Thanos, but not because it was out of character - it was because it was so relatable but at the same time an ‘aaaaugh goddamn it’ moment. 

So Quill had a pretty good arc. I don’t really give a shit about him, but I won’t deny he’s come quite a long way and Infinity War really showed some new sides to him. 

Then in Endgame his story and Gamora’s gets reduced to crude physical humor and a shitty joke.

And that’s it!

Sorry, Starlord, you deserved better.

peter quill

blog.description: what up I'm jay, im 16, and I never fuckin learned how to read | any pronouns | multifandom, mostly pjo & druck | i say I'm a fanfiction writer but I dont write | mostly just shit posting ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ | pfp by @kaechristen-art

summary: Bruh imagine how thrown off the world is though post snap-back like half the population is 5 years younger than they should be,...
body:
Bruh imagine how thrown off the world is though post snap-back like half the population is 5 years younger than they should be, they missed out on their lives and everything needs to be altered to accommodate them again, and they were all snapped back to wherever they were when they were first snapped, but obviously not everything is the same, and whatever was going on at the time of the snap wont be going on any more. Imagine you’re snapped back to school but it’s the middle of the night? Snapped back onto a roller coaster? Snapped back to a house that isnt there anymore??

Another thing to note is that in order for all of Peter’s classmates to still be his classmates in ffh, they wouldve had to have been snapped too, and then snapped back, otherwise they would all be around 20 and out of high school.

Like obviously it’s not as bad for adults, like Scott (even though he wasnt actually snapped, but it’s the same concept) could just go back to what he was doing. Sure he missed out on five years of his daughter’s life, but those things happen in real life anyway.

But imagine you’re snapped back and a bunch of the people around your age are suddenly five years older, people who were younger than you could be your age or even older than you are now. Imagine having younger siblings and when you come back they’re older than you. Imagine being a younger sibling and suddenly you become the older sibling. Imagine being a twin. Imagine being a teenager and having a significant other and then you come back and they’re five years older, or vice versa. If you were together as adults then you could potentially continue your relationship, but if you were together as teens? Theres just so much that could be messed up now
